ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: It gives us immense pleasure to share the activities and achievement of Mahila Samagra Utthan Samiti, Daltonganj. This organization has been working since 1990 at different aspect like as Water & Land management, Health & Welfare Sector, Education & Women Empowerment with primary infrastructure of development in rural sector of Palamau district at different blocks at the end of last year the organization is helping to SC, ST especially tribal women by the formation of SHGâ€™s, WSHGâ€™s by the using different programme of government of State & Central to income generation, capacity building, watershed, agriculture & husbandry & awareness programme on account of different attitude. The organization have been formed 168 SHGâ€™s with 1733 members. Out of 91 SHGâ€™s linkage with the banking facilities & connects with income generation by vegetable production. The MSUS helping in market linkage to SHGâ€™s no doubt by these activities the women are gaining knowledge of supreme spirit. At the present time the organization conducting training to the villagers an vegetable production, SHGâ€™s management and their record keeping, capital formation husbandry, sewing & cutting & communicational aspect by these training programme 1570 people benefited. By the watershed development programme at Palamau district 6 units working (6 Lift irrigation system, 7 Ahars, 5 Ponds & Land leveling on 30 Hcs.). By these programme 1500 Acs. Land get irrigated and 3247 people benefited. The prototype progrmme of welfare department is acting to promote irrigation system by 20 lift irrigation system, 10 Ahars, 10 Utthala Well & 10 Bari well; horticulture at 60 Acs. Land leveling on 50 Acs. By these programme above 740 people benefited and they get (2000-3000) Rs. Income per month. It is a formidable task for an organization, which is a not for profit organization and working for the promotion of the poor womenâ€™s community based organization. At the current session the organization not only fully prepared to meet the challenge of its own sustenance but also prepared itself more ambitious agenda. It is a credible resources organization at Palamau and have invested considerable amount of time and resource for developing new streadgy. Conclusively it is fact that the woman comes together and they host national flag in national festival in Naxal affected area.

Counseling to jail prisoners specially women prisoners under the FCC scheme of Central State Social Welfare Board, New Delhi is an important activity.

Nehru Yuva Kendras were established in the year 1972 with the objective of providing rural youth avenues to take part in the process of nation building as well providing opportunities for the development of their personality and skills. In the year 1987-88, Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan(NYKS) was set up as an autonomous organization under the Government of India, Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, to oversee working of these Kendras. NYKS is the largest grassroots level youth organization

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SINCE YEAR 2005 ONWARDS MAITRI TIRELESSLY WORKING FOR OVERALL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IN MANY DISTRICTS OF JHARKHAND STATE. IT HAS BROUGHT TREMENDROUS CHANGE AMONG THE 30,000 VILLAGERS RESIDING IN THE REMOTE UNDVELOPED VILLAGES OF JHARKHAND. AROUND 1200 PATIENT HAVE GOT BACK THIER NORMAL EYESIGHT THROUGH CATARACT EYE OPERATION. MORE THAN 250 WOMEN SHGS ARE FUNCTIONING SMOOTHLY IN AND AROUND THE RURAL VILLAGES OF MAJOR OPERATIONAL DISTRICTS IN JHARKHAND. PROMOTION OF SAFE DRINKING WATER, SAFE DELIVERY, AND PREGNANCY GAP ARE SOME OF THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES BEING FOCUSED AS INPUTS AMONG THE VILLAGERS. MORE THAN 600 RURAL ARTISANS HAVE BEEN TIE UP WITH BETTER HEALTH INSURANCE POLICIES. RUNNING FREE EHALTH CHECK UP CLINICS IN RURAL AREAS TO SERVE THE HEALTH BENEFITS. APRT FROM HEALTH SECTOR AROUND 5000 CHILDREN AND 1500 ADULT WOMEN HAVE BEEN EDUCATED. MORE THAN 50 NFE CENTERS ARE RUNNING THROUGH WHICH AROUND1500 SMALL CHILDREN ARE BEING EDUCATED. VOCATIONAL TRAINING FOR SKILL ENHANCEMENT TO PROMOTE SELF EMPLOYMENT IS ON PRIORITY. WITHN THE SPAN OF FOUR YEARS AROUND 400 WOMEN AND UNEMPLOYED YOUTHS HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN DIFFERENT SECTORS LIKE HANDICRAFT, VERMICOMPOST, VEGETABLE CULTIVATION, MUSHROOM PRODUCTION, POUTRY, GOATRY, TAILORING AND BAMBOOCRAFTS. MORE THAN 50 PERCENT OF TRAINED BENEFICIARIES HAS ALREADY INVOVLED IN THIER SELF BUSINESS. BETTER USAGE OF NATURAL RESOURCE IS FOUND IN THE OEPRATIONAL VILLAGES OF THE ORGANIZATION IN JHARKHAND. AT PRESENT THESE ACTIVITIES ARE OPERATIONAL TO MORE THAN 250 VILLAGES.

CWD’s are not taken as a part of society but are assumed as curse on the family. Despite of several schemes and provisions by state and central government for uplifting the condition of CWD but negative approach and corruption has resulted in poor condition of the children with disability.

Through this project we are aiming to work in the direction of curbing land degradation and also building the capacity of community on different fronts for a better living. This will be an integrated approach to tie up all the loose end with the available resources. Capacity building and convergence will be the two main pillars of success for the program.

To ensure the overall development of the community through empowered local institutions so that the optimum utilization of the existing resources are ensured, and become self reliant and ensure their family income through targeted interventions and various income generation activities and improved health.

The proposed interventions to support and help to developing tribal communities will reduce poverty and improve rural livelihoods and food security by increasing agriculture productivity, linking farmers to markets, reducing risk and vulnerability, improving non-farm rural livelihood and providing technical assistance through increased agriculture production and productivity can improve their livelihood base and reduce the poverty.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The purpose of the project was to impart training on Land Rights to Tribal People i.e Village Heads, Manki-Munda, Dakua and memebrs of Gram Sabha both men and women.The training was focused on Wilkinsons Rules, 1833, CNT Act, 1908, Land Acquisition and Rehabilitation Act, 2013, Land settlement under the provision of Munda Bandobasti on Government Partiland to needy tribal people and get it mutation, make them understand on Hakuknama and also Forest Land Right Act, 2006 for the Forest dwellers.

The purpose of the project was to awareness building towards make them able to understand Tribal people on Land Rights, Wilkinson Rules, 1833, CNT Act, 1908, Forest Land Rights Act, 2006, Partiland Bandobasti provision under village Munda bandobasti right in Kolhan Region. Survey conducted to identify tribal families who have occupied forest land before 2000 for agriculture and hosing purposes for their survival. It was also the line of make them educating on process how to obtain forest lands

The purpose of the project was to start the process to obtain Forest Land Rights claim documents and land settlement documents from the concerned Circle Office. The Gram Vanadhikar Samitti formed in 50 indentified Tribal families in forest areas to establish legal right on the occupied forest lands. The intervention was to assist them to obtain Land Rights claim forms, residential and caste certificates from the competent authority and also filling of claims forms properly and submitted to C.O.

The purpose of the project was to follow up the development of process done by the Gram Vanadhikar Samitti for the forest villagers in Circle level. The frequent follow ups was made on confirming status of the claim forms pending before the office of Circle Office, Sub- Divisional Office, Forest Department and District Welfare Office for clarify of submitted documents along with member of Gram Vanadhikar Samitti. Process was also started to mutation of ancestors’ lands among the brothers.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The society aims at community development so as to improve the quality of life of the people. The society recognizes the inherent dignity and equal and inalienable right of all members in the community. Society is committed to extend adequate services of health, well being, social security, and education to the deprived sections of the tribal people. The aim is to introduce to ensure and safeguard the rights and interests of the Adivasi people, protect and promote their language, culture and identity. Look after the welfare and development of the tribal women who have migrated to different cities and towns and those who are at the verge of migration from the tribal areas. Undertake suitable intervention, training and job generation activities to channelize these migratory lots. Work for the overall social, cultural and economic development of the Tribals. We are looking to improve the educational standard of the people, especially for women and children, to help encourage financial savings in the community through self help groups, provide savings and credit linked assistance to ensure economic growth and productivity, to help provide opportunities in healthcare through community based initiatives and try to remove all forms of exploitation and discrimination against tribal and work for tribal recognition at NCT Delhi. And also to ensure their participation in all aspects of life in nation building activities.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Aim of the project was to promote livelihood and of 20 women SHG members. Project implemented at Rohini village of Deoghar block. Promoted 20 livelihood through bari manufacturing. We are micro credit and marketing support sponsored by NABARD. We introduced grinding technology . Initially grinding was undertaken mannually. Drying technology has been also introduced.

Aim of the project is to promotion of livelihood in non farm sector through micro credit, technology and marketing support. Promoted 200 livelihood and 50 micro enterprises through micro credit and marketing support. Activities are undertaken through cluster promotion. Clusters are like dairy, bari, badhimala (worship material), tailoring, goatery, construction material, Fried rice (muri), pottery etc. Introducing skill enhancement also.

Aim of the project is to promotion of 20 livelihood and micro enterprises through tailoring cluster promotion in the Basukinath area. We have promoted 27 micro ventures in the tailoring sub sector. Out of which 7 is start up, 8 members enhance their business, 7 women joined in their family business. Project was successful in terms of promoting ventures ans start up. As the purchasing capacity of each households are growing demand for ladies garments are also increasing. Impact of growing venture
Promotion of 100 micro enterprises in the non farm sector

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. Sponsoring almost 200 underprivileged children through Education Vouchers which is Jharkhandâ€™s first privately funded program that provides financial assistance to parents for sending their children to schools of their choice. More than 20 children have passed their matriculation successfully in the past years and are getting their higher education in various colleges. 2. First NGO in Jharkhand that has set up URGE (Unlimited Resources for Gaining Excellence) centers at Ranchi & Khunti with the help of the community, where children and adults can use its resources (books, computers, etc) for being counted themselves into the mainstreams. 3. Facilitated more than 50 children across the country for getting education in their chosen private schools under Right to Education Act of Indian Government. 4.Impacted the lives of almost 500 children through Srijan Bachpan sessions on life-skills, personality development, decision making, etc. 5. First NGO that has set up a bank like co-operative in Jharkhand, run by the children and for the children, where children deposit their savings so as to be independent at times of emergency. More than 300 members are enrolled into it currently and saved an amount of Rs.90000 into their respective accounts. 6. First NGO in Jharkhand to set up a health co-operative run by the children for the community. 7. Empowered the women of Lodhma (rural) to form various groups to look after the overall aspects of development in their village. 8. Influenced almost 700 young minds of different colleges of Jharkhand to join the social sector and work for the society under the project YUVA of the organisation.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PRAVAH is a non-profit voluntary organization , registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860. It avails tax exemption status under sections 12A of Income Tax Act and eligible of receiving grants und Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA). PRAVAH was founded by a team of young social activists inspired by the values and movement of Jaiprakash Narain and Ram Manohar Lohia for a equitable just society. The organization started its development mission from 10 villages of Sarawan block in Deoghar district to improve the condition of vulnerable target groups especially women and children of tribal and dalit communities. Gradually Pravah consolidated its development initiatives through programmatic abilities and its rapport with the local community. While working with the poor communities hunger and poverty have been two key issues of organizational intervention and most of its programs are aimed to alleviate poverty and increasing food availability for the majority in a sustainable manner. Since the period of inception the organization works with the disadvantaged communities to improve livelihood opportunities and create an enabling environment for them to live with dignity. Over the period of past two decades as a learning organization PRAVAH has developed its skill, experience and efficiency in community mobilization process, community based natural resource management, livelihood, agriculture, local self governance, education, policy advocacy and community health interventions. Since the past decade PRAVAH has focused its approach to water based development and believes that in Jharkhand effective use of water sources is key to the livelihood of the people. The organization is backed up by a vibrant governing body, competent team of workers and expert advisers from different areas of specialization. It has good field presence in form of more than 150 self help groups, 26 gram sabha and other community based organizations. The organization has good working relation with different line department, government agencies, resource groups and civil society organizations across the state of Jharkhand .
